cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to accelerate WNW across the southwest Atlantic between Bermuda and the Bahamas Tuesday–Wednesday, then curve northwest and approach the North Carolina/South Carolina coastline late Thursday, likely striking the southern North Carolina coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern North Carolina coast near Cape Fear / Wilmington area

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast and Mid-Atlantic U.S. coast from South Carolina through Virginia, highest threat along North Carolina coast.
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (50–60%) of sustained 50-kt winds with up to a 38% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds near Wilmington.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Dangerous storm surge exceeding 3 ft is likely along the Cape Fear River and adjacent coastal areas if the hurricane makes landfall near Wilmington.
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rain bands could easily exceed 4–8 inches, with localized higher totals inland.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous surf and rip currents already occurring; possible coastal flooding and river flooding after landfall.
